website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for something a lot better, faster, and more sophisticated than a point-and-shoot that can stand up to your adventures, the Olympus OM-D E-M5 is a great choice.
pros: A dust-and-weather-sealed design distinguishes the Olympus OM-D E-M5 from the rest of the interchangeable-lens crowd, and its class-leading performance doesn't hurt, either
Plus, it's got an interesting, relatively streamlined shooting design
cons: The photo quality is solid, but not outstanding, especially if you shoot only JPEG

customer_reviews.title: 6 years later, still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this camera in January 2013. Now, 6.5 year later, the camera still shoots fantastic photos and meets or exceeds all my photography needs. I've gotten a few more lenses in addition to the kit (20 mm pancake, 45 mm prime, 40-150 mm, 12 mm prime). Love how this camera feels, the photos it shoots, and the way it looks!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I love Olympus
customer_reviews.text: Have 35 mm Om 1, and others which I loved back in the film days. I got canon dslrs which are great but I thought I would try Olympus micro four thirds so I bought this lightly used. The pictures are as good and the same mostly as the Canon but the Olympus is more fun to use. It looks like the old Om 1 and it takes old zuiko lenses with an adapter much better than a dslr. Also the OM D cameras do much better than Canon with stabilization.
customer_reviews.author: Burkc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera for this price range.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and flexible little camera. Haven't gotten any of the m4/3rds lenses that are recommended for this yet, but it takes great pictures with my old m42 lenses with an adapter. Just be aware, the RAW format this produces is Olympus specific, so it can be a little difficult to get free image processing tools to process the pictures it produces. I highly recommend RawTherapy for dealing with RAW files.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Kelderman

customer_reviews.title: A real deal
customer_reviews.text: I know this camera was listed as used, but other than not being boxed by Olympus, it was in pristine condition. I got as a spare as my OM-D E-M10 was in for repairs, and to my way of thinking, I got a more advanced camera for less than I originally paid for the M10.
customer_reviews.author: chipt

customer_reviews.title: Makes a humming noise when turned on
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to buy this camera. This camera body should never have been sold by Refi Japan in the first place. The loud humming noise when you turn the camera on needs to be fixed. I tried the body with 2 lenses, and it made the same noise. Serial number BEH502527. Returned the body. Hopefully, they will be honest and fix it before they attempt to sell it again.
customer_reviews.author: angeleno888

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from E-410
customer_reviews.text: What a great camera. It replaced an Olympus E-410 for us, and is smaller, lighter and very much more responsive. The autofocus difficulties of the E-410 are gone. (And as it aged the battery compartment of the E-410 kept popping open during use.) The moveable LCD display of the OM-D 3-M5 is great and very useful. The only drawback is that the lens mount has changed, and we decided to get new lenses rather than buy the adapter. I would recommend it to anyone. So much camera in a small package.
customer_reviews.author: David Boldt

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. I could run through all the stuff ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I could run through all the stuff that others have said in reviews but I won't. I'm just continually amazed at what the camera seems to be able to do. A couple of cons that I can live with are: The AF is always working so there is a low whirring when the camera is on. There may be a way to stop that but if there is I can't figure it out. (I have a pen PL5 and there is no noise.); I assume, because of this, the camera seems to use a lot of battery. Oh, I also think considering the number of features the camera has, it is not that hard to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing camera, especially for its size.
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these bodies after owning a Sony A900 system. I love the size and am amazed at juts how many features have been crammed into the firmware. In a medium backpack I am able to pack 2 bodies, 5 lenses, flash and battery pack and various other accessories without being overburdened. Both the pictures and the videos that I have shot have been first rate and I am convinced that there are still many nice features I have yet to take advantage of. I am well pleased with this camera body.
customer_reviews.author: styleon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice camera even after all these years
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera even after all these years. I bought this to replace an EP-3 which was a great little camera but the OM-D is faster, has a very good built in viewfinder and the photos are better quality with less noise due to the 16mp Sensor. I am using this with the Panasonic 7-14mm and it is a very nice lightweight super wide combination. It also came with the 12-50 lens which is weather sealed and amazingly compact and lightweight. The price drop on this camera and lens combination makes it a great deal and worthwhile upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Fe Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful size and photo quality
customer_reviews.text: the menu system is daunting at first, but I'm getting accustomed with where to go when I need to change a function. I've had some questionable problems with over-exposed photos, but the camera is fairly complicated so I trust I will figure out that I am doing something wrong. I also think the complexity is a plus. Learning to use such a camera is always steep, and will take awhile, so I expect this, knowing the feature rich aspect of this camera will pay off. I backpack with this camera and love the low weight.
customer_reviews.author: Pilot Mark in Arizona, USATop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this camera. Based on other reviews I chose not to go with the standard lenses and instead chose the Panasonic Lumix g 20mm pancake lens which I LOVE - so small and I took photos around the campfire on a recent camping trip, it's so great at low light. I might get a telephoto sometime soon but no rush - I like the simplicity of taking a wide shot and cropping in a "zoomed" photo in photoshop later. Got some nature shots of birds & alligators on the trip that way that look great.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mash

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: It will take a very long time to become familiar with all of this camera's features but I am very happy with the pictures I have gotten so far. Size and weight were a big consideration and I find this camera very easy to carry all day. Assigning functions to the various knobs and buttons was not difficult and allows the user to avoid scrolling through the menus to change functions. A bonus is that I find the design aesthetically appealing. This camera was a great choice for me and I look forward to many years of capturing photos with it.
customer_reviews.author: moon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first camera.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first camera and while now I sold it and use a Sony a6500, there are aspects of this camera that i absolutely miss such as the really cool filters. The touch screen put me ahead of most lame asses who used other cameras and the compactness was cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Acid Raen

customer_reviews.title: It's a lot funner than it looks
customer_reviews.text: It's small and packs a punch like a DSLR. I switched over from a DSLR to this to downsize and lighten my loads, but I found myself shooting more and having more fun with this camera than I would have expected. It's a lot of fun and you never really have to think to hard about whether or not you should take your camera with you or not(unlike my old Pentax K-5, which was already a fairly small DSLR).
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Other reviews really did not prepare me for how easily this camera helps me take great pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews really did not prepare me for how easily this camera takes great pictures. I'm still learning how to use the multitude of features, even though my previous camera was an Olympus E-500 (same menus, many similar features). But the OM-D E-M5 encourages me to try all sorts of shots I wouldn't have thought of attempting before. I think I will still be exploring the limits of this tool for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Koger

customer_reviews.title: fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good camera. There aren't a ton of lenses available for it compared to nikon or canon, but i think that's just a matter of time. The micro 4/3 format seems to offer a solid featureset and the size is very useful. The camera seems to be quite rugged and weather resistant. I've taken pictures in both rain and snow without covering it and haven't had any issues. Just make sure that your lenses are also weather-sealed.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore

customer_reviews.title: Camera of the year
customer_reviews.text: This camera won camera of the year for good reason. It's an excellent little camera. I have a Nikon D800 as well, and I wanted to use this as more of a travel camera for my trips to France. The autofocus is amazingly fast. I haven't done an actual scientific test, but it seems as fast, if not faster, than the D800. Build quality is also excellent. I have also used the camera with my PCB Einstein 640s for some Macro work. It is so handy to have a standard hotshoe on here for triggering the flashes. My only gripe is the buttons. They are squishy and small. Such a small gripe for an incredible camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Baylor

customer_reviews.title: My first micro four thirds
customer_reviews.text: This is my first micro four thirds camera. It came with the 12-50 kit lens and I added the 75-300 and the 60 macro. First problem was getting used to the EVF. I now like the EVF. Have some trouble with the small buttons but also adapting to them. The three lenses are of good quality and the image quality is high. I have had it for four months now and will stay with the micro four thirds system. I like the small size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Herman Moulden

customer_reviews.title: Slow autofocus
customer_reviews.text: I'm still learning the camera. My only complaint so far is that it sometimes takes a long time for the autofocus to settle in. I bought it to take pictures of wildlife and it's not really doing that good a job. The autofocus goes all the way from one extreme to another before finally settling in and I've missed several photos waiting for it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. BynackTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: DSLR to This!
customer_reviews.text: After being tired of being weighed down by my DSLR and L Series lenses I made the commitment to sell it all and opt for this beauty. I haven't looked back yet! Very light, quality is amazing! Lenses are cheaper as well. I also feel as if I go under the radar when out in public. Nobody has their eyes on such a small cheap tourist looking camera right? Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: bigapple83

customer_reviews.title: Good value for Price
customer_reviews.text: Good value for Price. Items is as described. Packaging was good with adequate protection. Fast shipping. Everything as promised!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Paschen Sr

customer_reviews.title: beast of a camera!
customer_reviews.text: A beast of a camera for it's size, and highly capable considering it's price! Creative freedom, expert controls, weather sealed -- what more do you need!
customer_reviews.author: ransur0t

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera, first addition so the screen diesnt flip ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, first addition so the screen diesnt flip like the latest model. Still getting used to the change from slr but, so far, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Noah gottlieb

customer_reviews.title: OM-D/E-M5
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera! Compact, well designed, both from photography and ergonomic standpoints. Lots of functions, many capabilities. Kit lenses are quite good, especially the macro setting of the 12-50. I did get an adapter for my 4/3 lenses - works just as well. Lots to learn - read the manual!
customer_reviews.author: Stonehollow

customer_reviews.title: I had E-PL5 which had to replace as water went ...
customer_reviews.text: I had E-PL5 which had to replace as water went in during recent hike. So decided for OMD E-M5. Did not need the extra bells & whistles of Mark2 or EM1. Wanted weatherproof so other models were out. This is a major step from E-Pl5 in terms of stabilisation and EVF because of which pictures are much sharper. There is not much difference in sensor in E-PL5+ models or OMD models
customer_reviews.author: Ramesh Patodia

customer_reviews.title: It is the perfect camera!
customer_reviews.text: That's right as far as I'm concerned it is the perfect combination of size and quality! Had it for two months and am totally blown away by what Olympus was able to pack into this small camera body. Take some time to read the manual and learn all it's capabilities and the reward will be outstanding photos.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisA

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice For Legacy Glass
customer_reviews.text: I'm using legacy manual Zuiko lenses with this camera. Easy to focus with the EVF, beautiful sharp detail.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Sorrell

customer_reviews.title: Incredible camera
customer_reviews.text: What can I add to the already glowing reviews of this camera? Only that I agree whole-heatedly! By far the BEST camera I have ever owned. It is lightweight & fast. The lenses available (from Olympus, Panasonic, & even Sigma) are superb. Even the 'kit' zoom is very good, far surpassing a few I've had on film & digital SLR's. It is very well made & feels good in MY hands. If you have large hands buy the 2-part grip/battery holder. Otherwise, you might be a little 'cramped'.
customer_reviews.author: R. Allen

customer_reviews.title: problems
customer_reviews.text: bought in 2015, malfunctioning in 2017, repair approximately 200., also sent back Pen F for electrical problems. Bye, Bye Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: raymond biasotti

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly fast and accurate - Lovely Image detail
customer_reviews.text: fantastic...sharp details and FAST FAST FAST FOCUS---GREAT!!!! I love the quality and image sharpness even at high speeds. I reccomend this to any candid shooter! This is one of the most enjoyable cameras I own..I own Canon Mark 5D ll and many others for example. This camera is killer good.! get one quick!!!
customer_reviews.author: eTrips

customer_reviews.title: I love Olympus
customer_reviews.text: It is very fast, sharp with beautiful color rendering! comes with 12-50mm lens which is very nice but buy Olympus 45mm if you like to have a beautiful bokeh!. with some adapter I use my Nikon, Konica, and Olympus lenses with it
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: The end of massive cameras.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera I ever owned. Makes you wonder why hauling a massive camera makes any sense. Seems stupid now that I have this one. Let's see the death of massive SLR cameras!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Cieszewski

customer_reviews.title: Best in the west (and east)
customer_reviews.text: Image quality is excellent, with great features like 5 axis stabilization built into the camera. The build, small form factor and handling are superb. There are vast array of lenses to chose from (Olympus, Panasonic, Voigtlander, etc.). Highly recommended!!! Chris Bowen
customer_reviews.author: christopher bowen

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I like the touch screen where i can choose focus point easily. The dual dial button is really helpful. Auto focus is really fast as what others said. Build and quality is good. Picture quality and color rendering is good. If only ISO 6400 perform better in term of noise handling, this camera can be the best camera. Viewfinder can be quite tiring if you are not used to it. It like looking tv screen close up.
customer_reviews.author: Agung

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has features and capabilities equivalent to physically larger cameras. It is a joy to work with. I would advise careful study of the full manual which is provided, in pdf format, on the CD included with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: C. Shoecraft

customer_reviews.title: A good camera, but the mode switch stopped working after a few weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: A good camera, but the mode switch stopped working after a few weeks of use
customer_reviews.author: kipan

customer_reviews.title: very good buy
customer_reviews.text: excellent professional quality camera , 16x20 prints ar no problem
customer_reviews.author: norwich urchin

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say that is not already mentioned in other reviews. This is a terrific camera and I can see definite image quality improvements over my older APS-C DSLR. Very customizable user interface.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Linn

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight, compact, has fantastic quick focusing, exceptional image quality, many many options, at the same time easy to use in an automatic or partially automatic mode. Looking forward to using this one! Get an extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: teacherdave

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I'll add my positive review to all the others. Features and quality of an SLR, approx the size of a P&S camera if you buy the pancake 14mm lens. Mine got stolen so I bought this to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good compact camera
customer_reviews.text: The Olympus OMD-EM5 is a good compact camera that is very versatile. It is light and compact yet has an array of features. The good: a lightweight body, plenty of customizable controls, a built-in viewfinder, fast autofocus. The not so great: small controls, average image quality, and quirky menu system.
customer_reviews.author: derekr

customer_reviews.title: The best for me yet!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned so many cameras over the years I have lost count. The Oly gets a solid 5 stars from me. It is very small and built like a tank. It is lightening fast and an absolute joy to use. The camera is VERY customizable. And the most important thing is that I have way more keepers than ever before. I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Carmen R. Towles

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life
customer_reviews.text: I can only babble with joy...love the compactness, the art choices, the retro beauty, fabulous images, on and on and on..
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Brown Jensen

customer_reviews.title: D - M5
customer_reviews.text: Love the retro look and feel of the Silver casing. The 45mm 1.8f lense is awesome. Pic in low light are awesome without requiring flash. Do need to spend some time to get use to all the functionality of the camera. Strongly recommend an optional grip to better secure the palm. Overall, fantastic camera for fraction of the DSLR weight and cost.
customer_reviews.author: segovia1

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great camera. I love the size and the pro options available for you. This camera takes amazing pictures! I highly recommend this camera to my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Volodymyr Gulin

customer_reviews.title: excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Other people have noted how great the image quality is. I agree, but would add that I've loved the ergonomics. I didn't anticipate liking the very small front 'grip,' but it just fits magically and comfortably in my hand. Obviously, this may not be true for you, but it's a surprisingly good fit for me. Great camera.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Size and weight is everything here. Great Image, great functionality, great fun. Google this camera. Everything good being said about it is true.
customer_reviews.author: STO

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera !!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a major learning curve. At first I hated it, then I wanted to return it, then I started to get the hang of it, and now you could not take it away from me. It is excellent in regard to build, weight and the images are great. The 12-50 mm lens takes fantastic macro images although it is a light hog. I've also enjoyed the fact that with an adapter I can use some of my old SLR lenses on this camera and even a very old German PENTACON 200 mm lens ... and get some really special images. Buy one !
customer_reviews.author: Karl Havens

customer_reviews.title: Thank Olympus
customer_reviews.text: With this wonderful camera I did not lose any important shots, is a big leap added to the Micro Four Thirds system , thank Olympus The only drawback is the depth of field
customer_reviews.author: AlQusimi

customer_reviews.title: Just One Very Outstanding Camera.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great - I am a novice but it makes taking great photo very easy. I can only imagine how much better my shots will be when I figure out how to take full advantage of all its features. I love the touch screen focus point feature. Even with the 12 -75mm kit lens shooting indoors hand held without a flash produces nicely exposed photos. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: John ChiTown

customer_reviews.title: just so I would have a really good camera for the rare opportunities I have to get ...
customer_reviews.text: I foolishly sold my e-m5 because I don't get to shoot veryuch these days, immediately wished I hadn't (seller's remorse, if there is such a thing) and ended up having to buy another one, just so I would have a really good camera for the rare opportunities I have to get out and shoot. It really is an excellent camera, though I would have bought the m.ii if I'd had the extra money, I'm still happy with my gen 1.
customer_reviews.author: rigger7906

customer_reviews.title: An amazing Camera !!!
customer_reviews.text: So far, amazing camera. What I liked most: its size, wheight, quality of image, design, 9 fps, ISO up to 25600, fast auto focus..
customer_reviews.author: Nko Gonzalvis

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality even if I know nothing about photography
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to buy a good camera for a while and I finally got the money to do it. I have to say it has far more options than what I understood and still, by playing with it, I was able to get very good pictures at my latest trip. I still got a lot to learn, but I love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Fanny

customer_reviews.title: All the features of a DSLR at half tyhe weight.
customer_reviews.text: Small and compact, built remarkably well, full featured, excellent quality, and great photos. This will replace my heavy, bulky DSLR, without sacrificing quality and benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Totaly Top of the line camera!
customer_reviews.text: I was comparing the M5 to the new M1 and for the money I decided to get the M5 and I have NO regrets. I have previous lenses that I was able to use with the adapter and the picture quality was more then expected.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a terrific camera@
customer_reviews.text: I keep being surprised at how terrific this camera body performs. It is a second camera for my professional use, Olympus E-3 is my primary.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A Baier

customer_reviews.title: Great travel camera
customer_reviews.text: The OM-D E-M5 yields great images and is a great camera for travel. Its size and weight are a real plus when you are carrying your gear all day. The lenses for the micro four thirds system are also small and light and great for travel. For travel photography this camera is much better than a traditional DSLR. You don't lose image quality to have the pleasure of carrying a light compact system.
customer_reviews.author: W.K. Goe

customer_reviews.title: Top micro 4/3s camera at under $1K... and probably beats many at $2K.
customer_reviews.text: Tough to go wrong with this camera. I have had the DSLR Canons and the older 4/3s Pen. This is a huge step up from the Pens and it keeps a much tighter body than the bulky DSLRs. You can take this biking, hiking, skiing and not feel the load on your shoulders. I also shoot a lot of movies and the quality on this is stunning.
customer_reviews.author: mateo

customer_reviews.title: I love this name and it's products
customer_reviews.text: Ah! Olympus! I love this name and it's products! I have four Olympus Cameras and many lenses next to my Fujis and Sonys! and I love to have more Olympus maybe a EM5 II or waiting for EM1 II with 4K. Olympus knows how to make real Cameras with some of the best innovations in Photography!
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: OM-D
customer_reviews.text: useful and convience i love it and really recommended on this one. I and beginer of study Photo. It enough improving my skiils.
customer_reviews.author: Ruoshui Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Love my OM-D E-M5
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these and wanted to have the second one so I could have different lens mounted and ready to go. The camera and lenses are very light compared to a regular slr. Where I used to carry one camera I can now carry two. Fast to focus and nice sharp images. Having 2 of the same camera makes it easy to remember how to change settings.
customer_reviews.author: audrey harwick

customer_reviews.title: OMD EM5
customer_reviews.text: Sensational camera , however just a bit too small for me , and the ergonomics are so-so unless the optional battery grip is purchased. I have the Lumix G1 and it just fits me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: ZIJI

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: Truly fantastic camera. Small form factor, excellent quality pictures. My wife were always comparing her point and shoot pictures with mine. Even with previous DSLRs, she just admitted DLR pictures are better but kept her point&shoot. This camera just blow her away. Quality is so dramatically better, she does not want to use old one anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Yevgeniy Gutnik

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this to carry around with him at work. It is small enough to fit in his work bag. It takes great pictures. My husband loves it and would definitely recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry in NC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful images.
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a very fast and accurate autofocus, and produces beautiful images that are sharp and accurate. The menu system is not particularly intuitive, but it is easy to use the basic controls for most photographs. The first photos I took with it were amazing, much better than the Nikon DSLR that I had been using.
customer_reviews.author: Dan O'Neal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing back-up.
customer_reviews.text: This lil' bugger is an astonishing camera to have... as a back-up. Not quite good enought (yet) to replace your DSLR, but if I were Canon or Nikon, I'd be very worried.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy using this camera most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: Overall good camera. Good fit in the hands. Is still compact with the HLD option. Sometimes drops focus after locking on to subject.
customer_reviews.author: TJC

customer_reviews.title: OMD EM5
customer_reviews.text: I have this camera for 1 week now, still learning to use all the functions. Lack of built in flash however is at least an inconvenience. Having the small flash attached to the camera - thus protruding on top of the camera - affects its portability. I use flash as fill in flash on a sunny day. The provided unit is weak, not enough power. I wish Olympus would make another more powerful flash yet with low profile for the OMD. I will most likely leave the flash on the camera for walk around instead of in pouch!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shutter failed after 50 days.
customer_reviews.text: Shutter failed in 50 days.Spent an hour on phone with Oly tech.Called Amazon and they overnighted! me a new body,ppd ship+picked up the failed one at their expense.Disappointing failure but kudos to Amazon for not subjecting me to a 2 week+ repair.Camera seems good,my 1st digital interchangeable.Will update.
customer_reviews.author: offtheback

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. A good choice for travelling
customer_reviews.text: good looking and good build little camera. Overally good image quality but not as good as those taken from SLR cameras. short battery life. The small flash comes with the camera socks. Sometimes difficult to hold.A good camera for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Fair price, shipped and packed great, arrived on time.
customer_reviews.text: Expectations of a Brand new device to be delivered on time were met! Opened box and everything was in its place, charged battery and left next morning for Italy. Picture taking was fabulous, size and weight feel just right, maybe perfect, and rain did not stop us...buy yours from these guys!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: i think this is a good camera, only regret was that i bought just the body and later went for the 45mm 1.8 lens, which s prime and expensive...... also got the lens cap lens. Takes good pictures , no problem yet...
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Osadebe

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: I liked the camera very much. No regrets for selling my DSLR to buy this one. My only complains are regarding: - poor users guide. So many options to configure and use and not enough information about the camera. Fortunately, there are some blogs that help. Only 1 star for the users guide. - the only book I found about this camera is in german language for iBooks. What I liked most: its size, wheight, quality of image, design, 9 fps, ISO up to 25600, fast auto focus.
customer_reviews.author: BetoJ

customer_reviews.title: The small notable..
customer_reviews.text: Olympus did a great job. The best camera what already launched! Perfect for those who wish to balance quality with low weight and compact volume.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo N.

customer_reviews.title: A great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. I am not a critical reviewer. If you have owned Olympus you already know what you are in for. I have owned several Olympus and always seem to return to them. I have owned Sonys and canons, but I always seem to come back to Olympus. They work and help make you a better photographer. I would recommend this camera and the micro 4/3 system to anyone who wants a digital camera, that won't break the bank and will give the user lots of opportunity to grow as a photographer.
customer_reviews.author: John Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have had the camera for a short time,but I am already very pleased with its performance and its practicality.I intend to purchase a mid-range telephoto and a prime after which this may become my go to camera.
customer_reviews.author: Eliseo Gonzalez-Urien

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: it took a little to learn, but all i can say is WOW. i love this camera i am almost 70 and hy hands hurt and this camera worked just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Glogovsky

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera. Still learning all the features
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera. Still learning all the features, despite the model being a little out of date. Powerful enough to make you leave your DSLR at home!
customer_reviews.author: Darielle D Fort

customer_reviews.title: Superb images
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this camera for about a month after a long-desired upgrade from my older digicam. Wow what a difference. Great size, easy to handle. Superb images.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rand

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy from this seller. As soon as I started shooting with it and really testing it out the dang thing keeps locking up on me. Never had any problems with any of my canons EVER and I shoot everyday. ALOT. Bought this to travel with and nope. I'll return every last single thing I bought for this POS. I pay good money for equipment and I expect it to work.
customer_reviews.author: deester

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic mirror less camera! Extremely responsive, lightweight and capable of taking great shots.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Donahue

customer_reviews.title: They love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Unreal photos from such a small package. I purchased these for my yearbook class students. They love this camera. Especially it's ability to focus quickly. The tap to take a picture function is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Zarate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Great features. Great image quality. Its perfect for travel and street photography.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pictures
customer_reviews.text: Great compact (kinda) camera with some great and growing lens options. Best camera I have ever had, very sharp rich pictures. Fairly complex menus can be confusing -- but that comes with choices. I would have given it five stars except the auto focus continually searches in ways and at times I've never seen in a camera. While taking video, this a serious issue. I've figured out some work arounds by not using continuos auto focus during video and using manual focus - but still a struggle. If Oly were to find a fix for this, I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: After posting, they promptly made it good

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm just loving it! You can see how much effort and studies were made to create this camera. The touch focusing it's unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Olympus OM-D is the best mirrorless camera! Fast focus and bright foto! Camera is simple to operate and multifunctional. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: 13ferz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for the money. But get the pro glass.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: The quality is perfect, I love it but
customer_reviews.text: The quality is perfect, I love it but, if you gonna take pictures in places like Miami with a lot of humidity the viewfinder would be damaged, be careful with this model E-M5.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent micro third camera
customer_reviews.text: When you're travelling a lot and like do outdoor. This is the camera that you should bring. Very light and has sharp picture.
customer_reviews.author: sQuiD

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Came very nicely with a book included. It even came with a Gariz case which costs about $89.
customer_reviews.author: GX107785

customer_reviews.title: Quick clear focus!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Olympus OM-D E-M5 16MP Live MOS Interchangeable Lens Camera with 3.0-Inch Tilting OLED Touchscreen [Body Only] (Black) to use with my 14-150mm olympus zoom lens. Work great together! Quick clear focusing!
customer_reviews.author: FL

customer_reviews.title: La mejor cámara que he tenido... The best camera I've ever had ...
customer_reviews.text: No encuentro cómo evaluar esta cámara ya que es muchísimo mejor de lo que un fotógrafo (entusiasta o profesional) pudiese llegar a necesitar. Le recomiendo a cualquiera que desee la mejor calidad de imagen, el mejor desempeño a ISO altos y el máximo rango dinámico. I can not find how to evaluate this camera because it is much better than a photographer (professional or enthusiast) could possibly need. I recommend to anyone wanting the best picture quality, the best high ISO performance and maximum dynamic range.
customer_reviews.author: MRMD

customer_reviews.title: Good product, smooth delivery
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as an addition to the camera. Works well and is well worth the price. The delivery was timely and smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: OM-DE-M5
customer_reviews.text: Great results, still a lot to learn invoice lists a silver lens, received black lens, which I prefer. will keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Not quite perfect...
customer_reviews.text: I admit I bought this camera for its looks. It is beautiful and takes beautiful pictures. BUT: the menus are the most difficult I've ever come across, there is no in-camera HDR mode, the flash is not built in, and attaching it with the cheap plastic little parts is a drag (although you would rarely need it since high-ISO performance is very good) and it is just a little TOO small for my larger than average hands. I think the new OM-D E-M1 addresses most of these issues, but it doesn't come in silver!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Poor and dull image quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera exhibits okay or so so image qualities with 12-50 lens. Dont expect stunning images as you might have seen on review sites.you need to buy expensive prime lenses to generate stunning images which will rack your bank if you try to buy 75 mm or 12 mm prime.Never buy if you expect stunning images with kit lenses.Period.Internet reviewer (Mostly all the internet review sites post processes their images in LR4 for this camera and they dont tell viewer to lure them to buy this ) have blown this thing out of proportion.too much hype for this camera.This is not aps c sensor hence it suffers in low light condition badly once ISO is bumped over 800.
customer_reviews.author: BlueBerryGrass

customer_reviews.title: This camera is the absolute worst camera I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the absolute worst camera I have ever purchased...including some that were significantly cheaper. It rarely focuses and its battery life, including from the very beginning has been marginal. A local camera store highly recommended it but I purchased from Amazon as they did not have it in stock. I have tried new charger, battery and different lens. The goal was to get something more compact than my beloved Nikon D80 but with almost similar performance. I have taken my Nikon back to the repair shop again as I can't justify another camera purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mauspie

product_meta.title: Olympus OM-D E-M5 16MP Live MOS Mirrorless Digital Camera with 3.0-Inch Tilting OLED Touchscreen [Body Only] (Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Style:Body Only| Color:Black| Configuration:US VersionA new era in Micro Four Thirds technology is about to begin. The new, revolutionary mirrorless camera, the OM-D E-M5, has an exceptionally light and compact body. Its Electronic View Finder enables photographers to check exposure levels, white balance and preview Art Filter effects in real-time.What’s in the box: Olympus OM-D E-M5 Micro Four Thirds Digital Camera (Body Only, Black), FL-LM2 Flash Unit, BLN-1 Lithium-Ion Battery, BCN-1 Battery Charger, Body Cap, USB Cable, A/V Cable, Shoulder Strap, Olympus Viewer 2 CD-ROM and 1-Year Limited Warranty. 

Use this comparison chart to compare all of the Olympus OM line.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER



THE BEGINNING OF THE NEW
A new era in digital SLR technology is about to begin. Up to now, digital SLRs simply replaced film with an electronic imaging device, which did not significantly change the products in terms of size, weight and user interface. The new, revolutionary mirrorless camera, the OM-D E-M5, has an exceptionally light and compact body. Its Electronic View Finder enables photographers to check exposure levels, white balance and preview Art Filter effects in real-time. When shooting, the photographer can instantly "create" a truly unique world and preserve it in exceptional quality. The "world" will be transformed from something you see to something you "take part" in.

The OM-D is a groundbreaking, new digital interchangeable lens camera perfect for people who want to "take part", "create", and "share".



ELECTRONIC VIEWFINDER
The OM-D's new high-resolution electronic viewfinder (EVF) features a 100% field-of-view coverage and 1.15x maximum magnification that let you totally immerse yourself in your subject, and actively control image creation. The EVF also enables you to enlarge the focus point for precision focusing in virtually any shooting situation, and can show you the effect of Highlight & Shadow Control, White Balance, Exposure Compensation, Aspect Ratio, and a host of other settings and advanced digital image processing functions right in the viewfinder. With improved precision and responsiveness that make it as easy to use as an optical viewfinder, the OM-D's advanced EVF gives you virtually unlimited creative control.


HIGH IMAGE QUALITY
Three key factors contribute to the OM-D's unprecedented image quality: a wide lineup of M.ZUIKO DIGITAL lenses for sharp, clear subject capture, a new 16-megapixel Live MOS image sensor for rich tonal expression, and an advanced TruePic VI image processor for superb color fidelity. The optimal balance of these factors ensures the high resolution, sensitivity, and color accuracy you need to brilliantly capture the world around you.


FAST AF
The world's fastest* AF system, FAST AF, has been made even faster and more accurate on the OM-D. Improved new 3D Tracking AF assures you won't miss the moment even when subjects move toward or away from you, and the new high-sensitivity image sensor ensures superior AF performance even in dim light. *Among digital cameras with interchangeable lenses available as of February 8, 2012, when using the OLYMPUS M. ZUIKO DIGITAL ED 12-50mm F3.5-6.3 EZ lens with the E-M5, based on Olympus in-house measurement conditions.



9 FPS HIGH-SPEED SEQUENTIAL SHOOTING
Thanks to the new 16-megapixel Live MOS image sensor's high-speed read-out performance, the OM-D offers maximum sequential shooting at 9 fps, making it easy to capture sports action or fast-moving subjects such as pets and wildlife. In addition, a compact new high-speed shutter mechanism enables the OM-D to offer this performance without compromising the handling advantages of a light and compact body.


5-AXIS IMAGE STABILIZATION
The OM-D is equipped with the world's first 5-axis image stabilization system, and can compensate for vertical, horizontal, and rotational camera shake that conventional 2-axis systems of the past have been unable to handle. Built into the camera body to ensure effective stabilization with all lenses, its unique 5-axis design makes it particularly effective when taking high-magnification telephoto shots, macro close-ups, and long exposures. In addition, it can be activated by pressing the shutter button halfway, so you can also use it to stabilize the viewfinder image and obtain a crisp, clear view of your subject that makes it easy to frame and compose your shots.


DUST-PROOF & SPLASH-PROOF CONSTRUCTION
Trouble-free shooting in all environments is assured by our proven dust-proof and splash-proof technology. Numerous specially constructed seals throughout the body protect the camera from sand, dust, rain, and water spray, making it ideal for all kinds of outdoor shooting. What's more, this protection extends to the M.ZUIKO ED 12-50mm F3.5-6.3 EZ lens, the bundled detachable flash unit, and the optional HLD-6 grip and power battery holder.



TILTING 3-INCH OLED TOUCHSCREEN
In addition to offering dial and button controls, the OM-D is the first Olympus camera to feature a tilting touchscreen monitor for intuitive fingertip operation. The 3-inch OLED touchscreen delivers high-resolution images of your subject with rich color reproduction. It also responds instantly to your touch with fast operation that makes it easy to focus on subjects, play back images, and adjust settings such as exposure and white balance.



LENSES AND ACCESSORIES
In addition to its new electronic motorized M.ZUIKO DIGITAL ED 12-50mm F3.5-6.3 EZ lens with quiet, linear drive AF, the OM-D is supported by an ever-expanding range of wide-angle, macro, portrait, and telephoto Micro Four Thirds M.ZUIKO DIGITAL lenses. System accessories include cases, straps, filters, external flash units, and mount adapters for Four Thirds System lenses and OM System lenses.
feature_bullets: Articulated 3.0 inch touchscreen LCD with 610,000 dots
Flash hot shoe and Olympus Wireless RC Flash system compatible
